events.name: Tuesday 26th May
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Don't forget! Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo and usually something for dinner. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! I know nothing about programming, is this for me? Yes! We are happy to teach anyone with any experience, if you are a quick learner that makes it even better.
events.location: TradeGecko Office, 101c Telok Ayer, 068574, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 4: Transport Layer Security (TLS). Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Reactive Programming Coursera - Weekly coding session
events.description: We are a group of passionate developers following the Reactive Programming course on coursera ( https://class.coursera.org/reactive-002 ). Come down and have a bit of fun coding the assignments with us! If you're doing the course and want to discuss the concepts, have gotten stuck on some syntax/integration issue or just want some motivation and dedicated Scala time then join us for an evening. Please try and watch the week's lectures beforehand. It's also a good idea if you download the dependencies beforehand too. (Though Lowercase cafe has good WiFi, so if you need to, you can setup your environment once you get here.)

events.name: Ethereum Visits Singapore
events.description: Join us for this Two-day event to learn more about block chain 2.0 technology and how it applies to the real world. We will provide an introduction to block chain technology and it's use cases apart from bitcoin. The second day of the event will be a coding workshop for everyone of all skill levels to participate and see what kind of interesting programs they can come up with on the block chain. Gavin Wood (Co-Founder of Ethereum), George Hallam and Ken Kappler will be speaking, and we will have live video conferences with a few start ups on the block chain, ie www.provenance.org. DigixGlobal (www.dgx.io), the first smart asset company built on Ethereum's block chain, will be helping to host the event. Calvin Soh will also be guest speaking. He was a creative director for several mnc ad agencies and is currently a branding and marketing consultant for innovative technologies. Amazing dinner will be served so come with empty stomachs and open minds! Spaces are limited so please sign up for this free and informative event!
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Economics, Level 2, Seminar Room 2.5, 90 Stamford Road, Singapore Management University, Singapore 178903

events.name: 1st Bluemix SG Meetup: Bluemix + IoT = Smart Data
events.description: Welcome to the 1st Bluemix SG Meetup. We will try to have a regular meetup on the last Thursday of every month. For this meetup, we have Stephan Wissel from IBM to talk about IoT on Bluemix. Find out how Bluemix can help you, a hardware and IoT maker, easily deliver huge amount of data from various sources to a single platform to easily make data smart, quickly transforming it through Node-RED and create something meaningful. We also have Nikolay Vlasov from IBM who will be demo-ing his Air Quality Sensor connected to Bluemix! Look forward to meeting everyone! Register here for your Bluemix account.
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Functional Programming from First Principles
events.description: Many recent programming languages, such as Javascript, Ruby, and Scala, include elements of functional programming. These languages are large and complicated, which makes it difficult to grasp the essence of functional programming. Church's Lambda Calculus is the oldest and simplest possible functional programming language. It has the following syntax: ::= a | b | ... | z ::= | (λ ) | ( ) In this talk, we will illustrate the principles of functional programming using Church's Lambda Calculus via a series of demos based on http://www.ioccc.org/2012/tromp/hint.html About the speaker: Melvin Zhang is an avid programmer who enjoys minimal programming languages and elegant algorithms. At Cosmiqo International, Melvin is developing its sensor data aggregation and analytics platform. In his free time, he is trying to create the strongest AI to play Magic: the Gathering @ https://magarena.github.io/ Venue sponsor: Plug-In@Blk71, Managed by NUS Enterprise 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-18, Singapore 139951
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: Ruby Meetup, RDRC Edition
events.description: Hi everyone! This month we're pushing our regular meetup back to coincide with RDRC and catch up with our international friends in town for Ruby week! If you're in town for the conference, or just in town, come join us for pizza/talks: Date: Tuesday, the 2nd of June, 7.00pm Venue: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, 188969, Singapore We're always looking for new speakers, and we'd especially love to hear from folks who are visiting Singapore that week! Ping us (Anna or Winston) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips (details below). See you there! -------------- 1. 2. 3. 5 Random Ruby Tips * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks: Venue:
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: Meteor June Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our June MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! *** Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - EJSON - Duncan Foster #2 - A Trio of Useful Packages : autoform, simple-schema and collection2 - Dan Tran An overview of a very widely used suite of Meteor packages from community developer 'aldeed': https://github.com/aldeed #3 - Show & Tell: - Package for Meteor Scaffolding - Tze Ken Le e #4 - Meteor Clinic: - We are going to try something new - if anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question ) #5 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #6 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Nitrous.IO office Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur
events.location: Nitrous.IO, 1 Trengganu St, 2nd Floor, Singapore 058455

Doors open at 8.15pm. Performance at 8.30pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Please note that due to high demand, registration is essential. Register here to attend: http://www.eventbrite.sg/e/chicks-on-speed-the-art-of-work-part-2-tickets-17026720379 Numbers are limited! Globetrotting performance, art, music, and new media collective Chicks on Speed take the stage this ArtScience Late with their special mix of irony and electronic beats. events.name: Tutorial on High Performance Cloud Computing Technologies: Julia &OpenTuner
events.description:
This one day tutorial will provide a deep introduction and hands-on experience with two emerging technologies that can help users efficiently utilize cloud resources. 
The first part of the tutorial will cover the Julia programming language. Julia is fast becoming the de facto language of technical computing and is finding new applications every day such as in databases and embedded systems. This workshop will introduce the language and also present use cases for technical computing, statistics, big data applications, high performance, and in education. The workshop, aimed at professionals, researchers, and students, will illustrate how Julia's ease-of-use and fast execution go hand in hand. Upon completion of this workshop, attendees will understand what Julia has to offer over other open source systems such as Python, R, and even commercial systems as well. Julia’s dynamic system allows for scalable fault-tolerant cloud based systems. Examples of Julia running in the cloud will be provided. We will explain Julia’s design including multiple dispatch and the sophisticated type system, and why engineers, scientists, and statisticians can benefit from these concepts. Julia offers a solution to the "two-language problem" whereby one wastefully prototypes in one (slower) language and then deploys in another (faster) language. 
The second part of the tutorial will cover OpenTuner, a open source framework for building domain-specific multi-objective program autotuners, a simple way for improving the performance and efficiency of high performance applications. High performance applications have many tunable parameters. Finding the right values for these parameters for a given architecture is a challenge for many programmers. OpenTuner is a machine learning based framework that provides a simple workflow to find good configurations for even very complex parameter spaces. OpenTuner has been used by a number of different projects to build domain specific autotuners. We will also demonstrate available autotuners for the JVM and gcc that can give an immediate and significant performance boost for existing applications. 




  
Alan Edelman
MIT Mathematics and CSAIL
Professor


  
Jiahao Chen
MIT CSAIL
Research Scientist


  
Saman P Amarasinghe
MIT EECS and CSAIL
Professor
events.location: Stephen Riady Centre LT50 (Level 1), , University Town, 2 College Avenue West, Singapore 138607, Singapore null
events.group_name: Alan Edelman, Saman P. Amarasinghe, and Jiahao Chen

events.name: Code for Fun, Code for All
events.description: The “Code for Fun, Code for All” event is being co-organised with MOE CPDD to promote awareness and interest in computing. Attendees to this event have the opportunity to try different aspects of computing, including: - Scratch programming - Computer control of hardware and sensing - Basic sorting algorithms The event will run at two locations, with two different activities: - Scientist for a Day gallery: Hour of Code style stations, where attendees can freely walk in to an available station to try coding - Digital Design Studio: Workshop style activity on Scratch programming Interested participants can walk in, no registration required. *Do note that there is no admission charge for Singaporeans and PR. Kindly produce your NRIC when you enter. Standard rate applies to overseas visitors and all other residents
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: How to create a working & fluid prototype in 12 days - A Pop-up design studio case study by @Wang Xiaodan
events.description: This is a case study on how to set up pop up design studios to gain real time user feedback and rapidly improve it. The client who commissioned this product design project is an international Hotel chain. Our team at Thoughtworks worked on the redesign of their hotel booking process. Within 12 days, we did an inception workshop with extended stakeholders from the client side, provided interaction and visual design mockups, a fluid working prototype (smart phones/tablets/desktop), and conducted user testings in various hotel lobbies as well as 1-1 in depth user testings. Xiaodan joined Thoughtworks in 2012 as the lead user experience designer, She has 15 years experience in the online space, covering areas from interaction design to product strategy, design management to user research. Prior to Singapore, she worked at Yahoo! & Microsoft based in London. Outside of design, she is an artist by training, an urban gardener, a freelance writer and photographer. NOTE: Lunch for attendees will be sponsored by Thoughtworks
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: We will be holding a HEBOCON challenge as part of the South East Asia Makerspace Summit scheduled to be held from 5-7 June 2015. Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. This event will serve as a testbed for the organizers to improve the competition processes leading to the HEBOCON main event in July. Thank you. For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG

events.name: Get Kanban Workshop
events.description: Most awaited and unique Agile coaching & training workshop in town is LIVE now, Register now RSVP, Limited to 26 attendees The getKanban Board Game is a physical board game designed to teach the concepts and mechanics of Kanban for software development in a workshop setting. It has been described as the most effective way to teach Kanban. It’s hands-on, engaging, and fun.During the workshop the teams construct charts based on data from the game including a Cumulative Flow Diagram, and a Statistical Process Control Chart. Play and Learn Kanban About Maris Maris has 16 years of IT experience as Servant Leader, providing fiscal, strategic &operational leadership in uniquely challenging situations .He orchestrate as Agile Change Agent primarily in the role of Agile Coach and Enterprise agile Transformer.Maris has had extensive experience in architecting agile process solutions using the flavours of Scrum, XP, Kanban and Lean operational waste reduction and implemented in various types of projects. He specializes in XP engineering practices including pair-programming, TDD, ATDD, BDD and continuous integration. He holds Engineering Degree in Electrical and Post graduate in Software systems from BITS and Senior Management from IIM Calcutta. He holds CSM, CSP, PMI-ACP, SAFePC, PMP, PRINCE 2, ITIL, PMOC, TOGAF9, DAD-YB, and SCEA. How to reach, Step by step instructions: http://bit.ly/1bqTbB4
events.location: 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261, 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (RDRC Edition)
events.description: Come and join the special June Rails Girls meetup! Linda Liukas, the cofounder of Rails Girls, will be joining our meetup. And of course, we will still learn Ruby and Rails with our helpful coaches. How exciting will that be? So, free up your Saturday and RSVP your attendance. Agenda : • 9:30 - 9:45 Registration • 9:45 - 10:00 Introduction + Break into groups • 10:00 - 11:30 Code • 11:30 - 12:00 Break • 12:00 - 13:30 Talks by Red Dot Ruby Conference speakers + more coding... ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please drop us an email at elisha@learnemy.com or stania@thoughtworks.com and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Elisha (elisha@learnemy.com) and Tania (stania@thoughtworks.com).
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: ETSY Craft Party 2015 SINGAPORE
events.description:
Etsy is a marketplace where people around the world connect, both online and offline, make, sell and buy unique goods. Since 2010, Etsy has hosted Etsy Craft Party, a global celebration of meeting and making.  
This is the 3rd party in Singapore and we would like to invite you to come and celebrate this big day with us. Consider it like a Handmade Craft Holiday! 
This year's theme is Kaleidoscope: Paper Taking Shape. We will explore and make a few crafts with paper. How many pieces of papers form a picture? Let's create a variety of collage and paper cutting techniques. One of the crafts we'll be making is paper weaving. Combine your favorite images with embellishments like ribbon, yarn, colored paper, magazine pages, or even your child’s artwork, and you’ll have a one-of-a-kind statement piece to display in your home. 
ETSY CRAFT PARTY 
6 June 2015 
Time: 2-6pm 
Place: The Playtent  
Sign up today to find out what other fun crafts we will be making on the 6th! 
https://www.etsy.com/local/craftparty/event/23279223368/etsy-craft-party-2015-singapore-june-6 
BUT secure your seat through payment on this Eventbrite page. We can only take in those who have RSVP-ed and make payment. 
Add us on FB or instagram @simply4love and join our FB Group here 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/etsycraftivistsg/ 
For any questions, please email us at simply4love@ymail.com or whatapp 8298 4274 or 9067 0847. 
See you soon! 
#craftparty @etsy
events.location: The Playtent, , 180 Joo Chiat Road #02-01, Singapore 427451

events.name: Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop 2015
events.description:
CLEAN & GREEN HACKATHON 2015 
 The Clean & Green Hackathon 2015 (19 to 21 June) is a big step towards cultivating a collective environmental consciousness amongst those of us who call Singapore home. It's an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise and help us become a more active and gracious society, one that respects the environment and takes care of our public spaces.   
The Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop gives you the chance to gain deeper insights into the hackathon themes and apply them when designing appropriate programmes or applications that address these issues at the hackathon.   

  
Workshop Programme 
Drawing on design thinking principals, the workshop is designed to help you see the problems in new light and from other people's perspectives.    
• Introduction to the hackathon challenges: 1) Reducing Littering and 2) Reducing and Recycling Waste  
• Expert sharing on the topics, including current challenges and future opportunities  
• Hands-on group ideation exercise - share observations, participate in discussion, develop / record insights, ideation and sharing   
Date: Tuesday, 16 June 2015 
Time: 6.30pm - 9.00pm 
Venue: TBC 
  
More Info 
Find out more about the hackathon here. If you've got any questions feel free to get in touch with the hackathon organisers at  hello@upsingapore.com.

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome!
events.location: Penny Black, 27 Boat Quay, Singapore

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Saturday 20th, Sunday 21st and Monday 22nd June 2015 10am to 7pm (Last entry at 6.30pm) ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE Fusion 2015 School of Interactive Design and Media, Nanyang Polytechnic Experience a selection of vibrant new works created by students and renowned alumni from Nanyang Polytechnic’s School of Interactive & Digital Media. This will be a coming-together of both emerging and established talents. Come and interact with luminous artworks, a litmus paper activity wall and 3D illusion floor murals, amongst other engaging projects, only at ArtScience Museum’s Sunday Showcase.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: National Cloud Computing Distinguished Speaker Series - Brian Mathews
events.description:
Capture, Compute, Create: How cloud technology is changing design 
  
Abstract 
The impulse to design is universal, but the tools for changing our world have been limited. Recent cloud technologies are disrupting how professionals design, how non-professionals participate, and how new tools may solve the world’s toughest challenges. This presentation explores the cloud technology trends that are combining to revolutionize the future of making things: Reality Capture, Cloud Data, Infinite Computing, Computational Physics, and 3D Creation. 
  
Biodata 
As Vice President and Platform Group CTO, Brian Mathews helps shape the technology strategy for Autodesk’s platforms and products serving the design, engineering, and construction industries.  He also heads the Reality Computing and Sustainability Solutions business units.  Reality computing involves sensor techniques such as 3D laser scanning, augmented reality, photogrammetry, computer vision, and reverse engineering to model the world.  Previously, he was VP of Autodesk Labs, a hub connecting design professionals with innovative technologies.  He held Software Architecture and Engineering Management positions for collaboration solutions, data publishing, and the graphics technology used in several products including AutoCAD. Prior to Autodesk, he was the Chief Architect at Buzzsaw.com, the leading cloud collaboration tool for the construction industry, and held technical positions at Sun Microsystems and Ithaca Software. Mathews earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University. He was the original creator of the DWF format and holds a variety of patents.
events.location: Genexis Theatre, , Fusionopolis, 1 Fusionopolis Way, Fusionopolis (Connexis Tower), Singapore 138632

events.name: ISS Seminar - Online Collaboration: Fact or Fiction?
events.description:
Online Collaboration is the child of Knowledge Management and the Internet, a new paradigm of professional cooperation in organisations made possible by the social capabilities of the web. It is also the open secret to solving the productivity problems entrenched in many companies stuck in the world of emails and silos. Implementing and adopting online collaboration is, however, easier said than done.  
In this seminar, you will hear: 

State of online collaboration in Singapore
Overview of selected online collaboration tools
The importance of culture and adoption

 Who Should Attend Social Media Folks: professionals in the business of dealing with social, digital, marketing, branding, content, development and strategy, especially internal social. If you’re keen to find out what’s going to be relevant and beneficial to your business and life in the fast-paced world of social, this seminar is for you.  
For detailed agenda, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/OnlineCollaborationFactorFiction.aspx 
  
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.description: This is the second meetup of the re-inaugurated Singapore Clojure Group. We are a very mixed bunch, from newbies to Clojure to language contributors. We are enthusiastic about learning and using Clojure and promoting it's use through sharing. • This meeting will have a code review session en group of an exercise set before hand as we feel that's one of the best ways to get to grips with Functional Programming and Clojure • Demos, community members can demo any projects, ideas etc they want to get feedback on.

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.name: Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling Workshop 2015
events.description:
CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014 
















CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014







View this email in your browser











 









 


ANNUAL WORKSHOP 2014







 








  
25 JUNE 2014    ERC AUDITORIUM  NUS UTOWN,  CREATE  



GET DIRECTIONS














  
CENSAM 7th Annual Workshop  







Invitation from Organisers    The Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling (CENSAM) is pleased to invite you to its 7th Annual Workshop. In designing this year's programme, we have aimed at balancing scientific interest, diversity and accessibility for a broad audience. A number of CENSAM researchers and collaborators will present short talks, providing a flavour of the diverse interdisciplinary research being conducted at CENSAM. 
We are pleased to announce that Mr Choi Shing Kwok (Permanent Secretary, Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources) and Prof Peter J. Edwards (Director, Singapore-ETH Centre, SEC) will present keynote talks and will be available for Q&A. In addition, we have set aside significant time for poster sessions, providing space for interaction over refreshments. 
We look forward to welcoming you at CENSAM's 7th Annual Workshop. Please click the register button below and do not hesitate to contact us if you require further information/assistance.    (Feel free to forward this invitation to colleagues who might be interested in attending our workshop) 








 







REGISTER HERE











 








CONTACT ORGANISERS 













 

 

 


  



  


 




 







AGENDA






25 JUNE 2014, WEDNESDAY


08:00 - 08:30
Registration & Breakfast


08:30 - 08:45
Introductory Session


08:30 - 08:45
Welcome remarks and opening address - Leslie Norford (MIT)


08:45 - 10:00
The Marine Environment - Session chair: George Barbastathis (MIT)


08:45 - 09:00
Terrain-aided underwater navigation for small teams of low-cost AUVs - Mandar Chitre (NUS)


09:00 - 09:15
Touch at a distance sensors: neuromast inspired biomimetic nano-sensors for fish-like underwater sensing and navigation - Ajay Kottapali (CENSAM)


09:15 - 09:30
Holographic and compressive environmental imaging - Chen Zhi (CENSAM)


09:30 - 09:45
Sediment plume in background turbulence - Adrian Lai (CENSAM)


10.00 - 10:30
Coffee break


10:30 - 11:00
Keynote address by Prof Peter J. Edwards (SEC)


11:00 - 11:30
Selected posters overview - various speakers


11:30 - 13:00
Asian buffet lunch and poster session


13:00 - 14:25
The Climate Environment - Session chair: Paola Rizzoli (MIT)


13:00 - 13:15
Chasing rainfall variations using tropical corals and trees - Intan Suci Nurhati (CENSAM)


13:15 - 13:30
Climate variability and the geomorphology of tropical peatlands - Alex Cobb (CENSAM)


13:30 - 13:50
Integrating models and measurements to deduce the multiple sources and causes of the June 2013 haze event - Jason Cohen & Yu Xing (NUS)


13:50 - 14:10
Regional atmospheric and oceanic modeling of the maritime continent - Eun Soon Im & Danya Xu (CENSAM)


14.25 - 15:30
Coffee break & poster session


15:30 - 16:00
Keynote address by PS Mr Choi Shing Kwok (MEWR)


16:00 - 17:20
The Urban Environment - Session chair: Andrew Whittle (MIT)


16:00 - 16:20
Impact of urbanization pattern on Singapore's weather and climate - Xianxiang Li (CENSAM) & Tieh Yong Koh (NTU)


16:20 - 16:35
Carbon sequestration at neighborhood scale - Erik Velasco (CENSAM)


16:35 - 16:55
Biofilm monitoring in drinking water distribution systems - Masaaki Kitajima (CENSAM) & Charmaine Ng (NUS)


16:55 - 17:10
The new Marina Bay MRT station - numerical prediction - Yuepeng Dong (CENSAM)







 

 

 





CENSAM, 1 CREATE Way, #09-03 CREATE Tower, Singapore 138602   T: +65 6516 6129     E: censam@smart.mit.edu

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899
